messages.message:
Hi Engineering team - @Faisal and I came off a TDD yesterday with National Bank of Canada with some follow up questions to address below:

1. For our capabilities in NLP - what do we use under the hood? Do we support spaCy?
2. Do we have more generic primitives aside from get/name - Are there any plans to add other generic primitives? If so what?
3. What's our authentication process when calling an API from outside the platform? Do we use Oauth? Tokens?
4. How do we calculate confidence - realise we're not there yet but how do we ensure this is something we're thinking about and is part of our roadmap
Any help to any of the above questions would be greatly appreciated :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks team!

1. Can’t comment on `nlp_token_find` but we’re just at the start of using deep transformer (BERT) models for natural language understanding. 
2. @Aaron Vontell?
4. Definitely something we’re thinking about and actively working on.  We currently have the ability to expose OCR confidence; Blueprint has a concept of confidence in everything it does; and deep learning-based extractions also expose very meaningful confidence estimates.

1. We use a variety of frameworks under the hood, including spaCy, NLTK, fasttext, TF/Keras, PyTorch, and also transformers with more recent versions of Instabase
2. There are other primitives built into the platform, such as dates, person names, addresses, tables, and more. We are continuously improving these entities, as well as adding more entities. I can’t comment on the roadmap (it’s pretty use case dependent) but our docs + a tour of our Developer Exchange will shed more light on what we have to offer in this space.
3. Within the Instabase website, a developer can create access tokens which are used for outside API access.
4. What Daniel said! We use a mix of approaches to solve use cases (ML, rules, etc…), and so confidence scores mean different things depending on the techniques we are using. But we are actively thinking about this!

@Aaron Vontell @Daniel Cahn Regarding Confidence scores and reporting metrics on extraction rates - here's what BNC was thinking. Lets say they gave us a list of 10 fields to extract from 500 documents.
After the documents have passed through the IB platform, they want a Business end user (not a developer) to be able to see reporting metrics on those 10 fields.
8/10 had 100% accuracy with 100% confidence
2/10 had 90% accuracy with 95% confidence

Is this something possible today?
Is this during development or production?
This is very similar to a request I had from another customer.

Production. Basically lets pretend I am an end user.
I submitted a package of documents through IB. When IB returns the results, I want to know:
• how many of the documents had what level of extraction rate with what degree of confidence
• That way if I see a document that has a low level of confidence in extraction, I'd manually review it
• OR if I see a document with a low level of extraction rate with high confidence (not sure if this makes sense?), I may revisit the logic

@Kerry what does this look like currently with Human Review? On the confidence score side, it is highly dependent on the techniques being used, but in past cases we have used OCR confidence and thresholding to flag errors, flagging missing fields, and using confidence scores from some of the ML models such as person name and address
@Faisal this is exactly our goal, but I wouldn’t say our product is there yet
